definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: He picks up the snail and throws it as far as he can.
sentences.chinese: 他拾起蜗牛，嗖的一下扔的老远。

sentences.english: He walked through—and vanished. Poof ! Like that.
sentences.chinese: 他走了过去，然后就嗖的一下子不见了。

sentences.english: He twanged an arrow that missed the target.
sentences.chinese: 他嗖地射出一支箭，但没有射中目标。

sentences.english: He swished out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他嗖地一下蹿出了房间。

sentences.english: He chops through the membrane, and hydrogen whooshes out, spraying him with a mist of blood.
sentences.chinese: 膜被砍破了，氢气“嗖”地冒出来，并喷出一阵血雾。

sentences.english: He swished off the tops of the grasses with his cane.
sentences.chinese: 他用藤杖嗖地打掉草尖。

sentences.english: Up went the rocket into the sky.
A bullet whistled past his head.
sentences.chinese: 一颗子弹嗖的一声从他头上飞过。

sentences.english: The ball goes through and swooshes the net.
sentences.chinese: 球进嗖的一声穿过篮网。

sentences.english: He walked through-and vanished. Poof! Like that.
sentences.chinese: 他走了过去，然后就嗖地一下子不见了。

sentences.english: A snake darted out of the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 一条蛇嗖地从灌木丛中蹿了出来。

definition: to blow (as of wind)/sound of wind/sough
(onom.) giggling/breathing/tearing of paper, ripping of fabric etc
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: clamor/noise/(bound form) sound used to call cats
